column4: rkhunter gave me some warnings :S can someone please help me figure out what they mean?
Whats the output of lsb_release -sc please?
You are on a virtual server, arent you?
give it to me straight doctor :D
you coulkd check packages.ubuntu.com so see wether that sudo change was an update.
never done anything like that before - could you tell me how to go about it?
There is a search form for files on that page. You could use it to search for /usr/bin/sudo and see when that file was last updated officially.
sry for stupid question, but will sudo be in natty-updates under the utilities category?
When there have been updates for it, yes.
found it, but i can't find a timestamp for last update http://packages.ubuntu.com/natty-updates/admin/sudo
You could use the changelog on the right side.
phew, the changlog timestamp corresponds with the log. do you know any other ways i can check for backdoors or other inconsistencies in the system? in any case thank you so much for the help :)
You could use the package "chkrootkit" too.
chkrootkit gives me nothing! thanks again
